short_description: Generates an AML file from input model tables.
long_description: AMLGenerator generates an AML file from input model tables. The AML file is generated on the specified path location intended for Scoring use.

input_tables.name: ModelTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the input model table representing input data for which aml file is to be generated. The table could be either database tables or files installed on the database.
input_tables.description: Specifies the input model table representing input data for which aml file is to be generated. The table could be either database tables or files installed on the database.

input_tables.name: ModelTable2
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the second input model table representing input data for which aml file is to be generated. The table could be either database tables or files installed on the database.
input_tables.description: Specifies the second input model table representing input data for which aml file is to be generated. The table could be either database tables or files installed on the database.

argument_clauses.name: ModelType
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the function name for which this aml file will be used. For predictors, this represents the type of the model trained.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the function name for which this aml file will be used. For predictors, this represents the type of the model trained.

argument_clauses.name: RequestColNames
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the column names of the request to be scored. For a predictor, these column names typically match the columns names of the training data used to train the model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the column names of the request to be scored. For a predictor, these column names typically match the columns names of the training data used to train the model.

argument_clauses.name: RequestColTypes
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the column types of the request to be scored. For a predictor, these column types typically match the columns types of the training data used to train the model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the column types of the request to be scored. For a predictor, these column types typically match the columns types of the training data used to train the model.

argument_clauses.name: ModelTableTag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input model table tag for input model table specified in model.table clause.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input model table tag for input model table specified in ModelTable clause.

argument_clauses.name: ModelTable2Tag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the second input model table tag for input model table 2 specified in model.table2 clause.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input model table tag for input model table specified in ModelTable2 clause.

argument_clauses.name: InstalledFile
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the file installed on the database representing input data for which aml is to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the file installed on the databased representing input data for which aml is to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: InstalledFile2
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the second file installed on the database representing input data for which aml is to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the second file installed on the databased representing input data for which aml is to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: InstalledFileTag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input installed file tag for input installed file specified in installed.file clause.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input installed file tag for input installed file specified in InstalledFile clause.

argument_clauses.name: InstalledFile2Tag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input installed file tag for input installed file specified in installed.file2 clause.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input installed file tag for input installed file specified in InstalledFile2 clause.

argument_clauses.name: AMLPrefix
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the generated AML model file. Default value is “model”. The output file is stored with suffix “.aml”.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the generated AML model file. Default value is “model”. The output file is stored with suffix “.aml”.

argument_clauses.name: OverwriteOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the output AML model file should be overwritten or not if already exists.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the output AML model file should be overwritten or not if already exists.

argument_clauses.name: RequestArgName1
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the argument clause name for the function to be used in scoring. These clauses are the same as mentioned in the corresponding SQL-MapReduce function documentation, with some exceptions. The request.arg.name should start from 1 in a sequential manner. For example, the following sequence of clauses is acceptable: request.arg.name1, request.arg.name2, request.arg.name3. However, this sequence is not acceptable: request.arg.name1, request.arg.name2, request.arg.name4. The maximum value of n is 30. The values for corresponding arguments are provided in request.arg.val clause.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the argument clause name for the function to be used in scoring. These clauses are the same as mentioned in the corresponding SQL-MapReduce function documentation, with some exceptions. The RequestArgName should start from 1 in a sequential manner. For example, the following sequence of clauses is acceptable: RequestArgName1, RequestArgName2, RequestArgName3. However, this sequence is not acceptable: RequestArgName1, RequestArgName2, RequestArgName4. The maximum value of n is 30. The values for corresponding arguments are provided in RequestArgVal clause.

argument_clauses.name: RequestArgVal1
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the argument clause value for the function to be used in scoring. The value in this clause corresponds to the clause mentioned in request.arg.name for the same value of n. These clause values are the same as mentioned in the documentation for the corresponding SQL-MapReduce function. The request.arg.val should start from 1 in a sequential manner, and follows the same format as request.arg.name. The maximum value of n is 30.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the argument clause value for the function to be used in scoring. The value in this clause corresponds to the clause mentioned in RequestArgName for the same value of n. These clause values are the same as mentioned in the documentation for the corresponding SQL-MapReduce function. The RequestArgVal should start from 1 in a sequential manner, and follows the same format as RequestArgName. The maximum value of n is 30.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
